result.execSummary:
All charges against Lionel A Armenta in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lionel A Armenta is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

EXHIBIT 1 (FLASHDRIVE) STORED IN COC RECORDS

09:02 AM Defendant Lionel A Armenta in court with attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. Prosecuting Atty Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin with intern Jackie Frank.   State calls Officer A. F., duly sworn. Direct by the State.  Witness id'd DE.  Cross exam by Atty Gonzalez.  Ex 1 marked, offered, and rec'd. Rediret.  Recross.   Atty Gonzalez calls De. Duly sworn. Direct by Atty Gonzalez.  Cross by Atty Rennicke.  Redirect. Argument by State. Argument by Atty Gonzalez.  Rebuttal argument.  CT: oral decision.   Grants Motion to Suppress.   State has 10 days to exercise right to appeal, if no appeal filed court will dismiss case.
Motion hearing on July 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

11:27 AM Defendant Lionel A Armenta in court with attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defense argument for court to hear suppression motion. If Suppression denied, DE will be entering a plea.   State argument.   Court will set for a Motion Hearing during time trial was set. Motion hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:40 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
